page.title: 18Amenities in Featherstone
page.content: Featherstone has no centre in which clubs and societies can meet.These are found in the public houses,working mens clubs and churches.A new library with a small social centre has been built and is to be opened shortly.This will be available to all clubs and groups in the town.There will be display boards for information,social advice and job vacancies in the centre. A childrens playground was designed by the Wakefield authority and built by the Manpower Services Commission on the land beside the railway.This is locked and only opened for a couple of hours on a Saturday. Featherstone lacks amenities for the young.Once they leave school and are unable to attend the youth club there is little for them to do,some go to the clubs in Leeds and Wakefield.
